Description: Terracotta figure. Fragment of bare foot. Mould-made and hollow with open back. Traces of white coating. Light red-brown silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine mica, quartz, black and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'B' (or '8') and '2' written in pencil on back.
Left foot of an Isis-Hathor figure made out of a fine silt fabric, probably fine Nile silt (Bailey 2008, no. 2994 and 2995).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.158) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 97, no. 362)
